<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Election update: </strong></span><span>Joe Biden was projected to win </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2020-election/trump-biden-wait-vote-counting-continues-states-michigan-pennsylvania-n1246402?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Michigan and Wisconsin</a></span><span>, two crucial states President Trump had carried in 2016. With ballots still being counted, several states remain too close to call, so we don’t know the results of the election just yet.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">More election: </strong></span><span>In a </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1324108200141082624?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweet</a></span><span> at odds with the democratic process, President Trump said his campaign “claimed, for Electoral Vote purposes” a few of the most contested battleground states, including North Carolina and Michigan. Twitter labeled the tweet as misleading, as it has done with several Trump tweets in recent days. </span>
</li>

<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/04/markets-powered-big-tech-shake-off-uncertain-election-results?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Honk If You Like Legislative Gridlock
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="gridlock in D.C." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDMxL2dyaWRsb2NrX2luX2RfYy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Joe Biden has a much easier path than President Trump to 270 electoral votes, Republicans are expected to retain control of the Senate, setting up potential <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/04/biden-future-if-wins-434013?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">legislative gridlock</a> between the executive branch and Congress that makes LA rush hour seem tame. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In fact, the specific combo of a Democratic president, Democratic House of Representatives, and Republican Senate hasn’t happened since 1900. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Stocks still went wild</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many investors had speculated a “blue wave” of Democratic candidates would sweep across America on election night. Such an outcome would have significantly boosted the chances of a coronavirus stimulus deal passing, but the prospect of more regulation and antitrust investigations under Democratic lawmakers gave Big Tech the heebie-jeebies. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Reality check:</strong></span><span> The “blue wave” ended up being more of a ripple, and Big Tech </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/04/big-tech-stocks-soar-as-results-still-come-in-from-nail-biter-election.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went gangbusters</a></span><span> yesterday, powering the tech-heavy Nasdaq up nearly 4%. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>According to Josh Brown of Ritholtz Wealth Management, U.S. stocks had their best post-election day rally ever.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The biz implications</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A gridlocked Congress wouldn’t just help Zuck, Bezos, and Co. escape greater regulatory scrutiny. Healthcare stocks also <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-04/health-stocks-wake-up-to-best-of-all-worlds-after-election-day?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped</a> on the reduced likelihood of any significant drug pricing reforms passing. Uber (+15%) and Lyft (+11%) rounded out the market’s jolly mood with a policy win of their own: Prop 22 passed in California, protecting their gig-economy business model from an existential crisis.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But buyer beware.</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>The last time Congress looked similar to the one we </span><span><em>could</em></span><span> end up with (in a Biden win scenario) was from 2001–2003, when Republican president George Bush was dealt a Republican House, a Democratic Senate, and a national emergency. Over those two years, </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-bad-historical-parallel-for-tech-investors-11604507035?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the Dow tanked 20%</a></span><span> and the Nasdaq lost half its value.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Without the support of the Senate, a Biden presidency could face an uphill battle to enact major policy changes or pass a sweeping stimulus deal. The knee-jerk reaction from investors? "Fine by us."</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/04/us-officially-leaves-paris-agreement?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Emily Out of Paris
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the U.S. <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/11/03/930312701/u-s-officially-leaving-paris-climate-agreement?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">officially withdrew</a> from the Paris Climate Agreement, the 2015 international accord struck by nearly 200 countries committing to sharply reducing emissions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How we got here: </strong>Leaving the agreement was a key plank in President Trump’s 2016 campaign. He notified the United Nations of his intention to bail exactly a year and one day ago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> In the biz world, the Paris Agreement has been an influential North Star for pollution reduction targets. Fossil fuel companies such as BP have shuffled their operations to help meet its goals. Major banks such as JPMorgan and Barclays, after outcry from activists, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-pledges-to-push-clients-to-align-with-paris-climate-agreement-11602018245?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have used</a> their power as investors to persuade clients to minimize their carbon footprints. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Joe Biden has pledged to rejoin the Paris Agreement if he’s elected. Under a Biden administration, the U.S. could be back on the list in mid-February. But if President Trump holds on to the presidency, we’re likely out for good. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

MARKETING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/04/gap-roundly-mocked-cringey-election-day-unity-tweet?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We’re No Marketing Brew, But We Know Better Than This
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Gap hoodie " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDMyL2dhcF9ob29kaWUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Screenshot of @Gap on Twitter</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Gap <a href="https://www.newsweek.com/gap-just-published-ad-about-closing-americas-political-divide-people-arent-happy-1544842?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offered</a> marketing folks a single-tweet course in what not to do. While users were drowning in electoral anxiety and uncertainty, it posted the above hoodie photo, quickly going viral and generating heaps of criticism. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What lessons does the since-deleted tweet offer? </strong>In the words of many critics, “read the room.” The online firestorm will probably discourage other brands from weighing in on the election, the NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/04/business/gap-red-blue-shirt.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>. </p>

</h3>

<a href="https://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=11_5_a_imagery" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not gonna lie, when Daylight Savings ended four days ago, we celebrated like it was our birthday. There may have even been confetti involved when the clock jumped back an hour.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And with the help of <a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=11_5_a_primarybody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP</a>, you can actually see what an extra hour of sleep is doing for your bod.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=11_5_a_primarybody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP is the no-nonsense wearable</a> that helps you know the inside of <em>you</em>—whether you’re accumulating sleep debt or ready to crush a virtual 5k with its 24/7 personalized metrics. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WHOOP also has a <a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=11_5_a_primarybody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sleep Coach</a> feature that tells you the optimal sleep and wake times and tracks your 4 sleep stages (we thought there was only one: snoring until our partner rolls us over), so that you can create a better routine. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Combine all that with <strong style="color:#000">critical health-monitoring features like daily recovery and respiratory rate monitoring, and you can know yourself, your sleep cycle, and your body—better</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=11_5_a_primarycta" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Try WHOOP today</a>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/04/saudi-arabia-lifts-restrictions-millions-migrant-laborers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Saudi Arabia Relaxes Rules for Millions of Migrant Workers
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An oilfield in Saudi Arabia " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDIyL29pbGZpZWxkX2luX3NhdWRpX2FyYWJpYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Saudi Arabia <a href="https://apnews.com/article/international-news-dubai-migrant-workers-saudi-arabia-united-arab-emirates-6cb5e681b00893e200fec707d92dba06?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">removed</a> longstanding labor restrictions that could affect 10 million migrant workers.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The kingdom’s oil-dependent economy has attracted workers from all over the world hoping to piggyback on the energy boom. It’s been such a popular work destination that foreigners now account for about a third of Saudi Arabia’s total population.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">However, under the Saudi “kafala” labor system, these workers are subject to severe restrictions, such as not being able to leave the country or switch jobs without their employers’ permission. Human rights groups say the system is easily exploited to abuse workers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Saudi Arabia isn’t lifting kafala measures because it feels particularly regretful. The move is part of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/12/business/saudi-arabia-oil-mbs/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vision 2030</a> that seeks to reduce the country’s dependence on oil and give it a broader makeover to attract international investments. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s also not the first Gulf state to ditch the kafala system. Qatar, which is hosting the 2022 World Cup, announced similar labor reforms in August.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F11%2F04%2Fsaudi-arabia-lifts-restrictions-millions-migrant-laborers" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+move+is+part+of+Crown+Prince+Mohammed+bin+Salman%E2%80%99s+Vision+2030&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/04/saudi-arabia-lifts-restrictions-millions-migrant-laborers&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VIDEOGAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/04/pokmon-go-made-record-1-billion-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pokémon Go Has the Very Best 2020
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Pokemon Go" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=475 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/QsSNR3g6Y9EluloH8A/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Pokemon Go" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/QsSNR3g6Y9EluloH8A/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s all Meowth money showers right now over at Niantic, the company behind the 2016 breakout augmented reality app, Pokémon Go. Turns out it wasn’t the summer fad we all thought it was. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So far this year, players <a href="https://sensortower.com/blog/pokemon-go-one-billion-revenue-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have spent</a> about $1 billion in the app, according to Sensor Tower, a 20% increase over the year it debuted.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FYI: The U.S. accounts for the biggest share of the app’s lifetime revenue and downloads.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Pokémon Go → Pokémon Stay</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Niantic <a href="https://pokemongolive.com/en/play-where-you-are/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolled out</a> a suite of features to help users play while hanging on the couch during Covid-19, including:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More Pokémon spawning near residences</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Virtual battles </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Discounted “incense,” the gaming item equivalent of putting a pie on the windowsill</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Mobile gaming as a whole is having a record year. Newzoo <a href="https://newzoo.com/insights/articles/mobile-games-market-engagement-revenues-covid-19-gaming/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimates</a> the industry will rake in $77.2 billion in player revenue in 2020, a 13% increase over 2019. Widen the lens even further, and all-things-gaming are <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/06/gaming-companies-unlock-record-earnings-q2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posting gains</a> amid the pandemic.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F11%2F04%2Fpokmon-go-made-record-1-billion-year" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

Brew's Bookshelf

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other Thursday, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> brings you a few of our favorite, business-related reads. Today, here are some thought-provoking books that are most definitely <em>not</em> about the electoral college. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780735219472?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Optimist’s Telescope</em></a></span><span> by Bina Venkataraman offers a useful framework for moving past our shortsightedness to plan ahead—both as individuals and as a society. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780525509035?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Price of Peace</em></a></span><span> by Zachary D. Carter is a fascinating portrait of economist John Maynard Keynes. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781419729072?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Invisible Women</em></a></span><span> by Caroline Criado Perez, which won the 2019 FT-McKinsey book prize, examines the long legacy of women being overlooked in data science and the very real (and sometimes dangerous) implications.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Check out the rest of our Bookshelf recommendations <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. </p>

GAMES

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Three Headlines and a Lie

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/police-cars-revolving-light_1f6a8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Scheduling alert <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/police-cars-revolving-light_1f6a8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> </strong>As longtime readers know, we typically do our headline quiz on Saturdays. But as we mentioned earlier this week, we’re shuffling some dates around in the Games section of the newsletter to make it a better experience for everyone<strong style="color:#000">. </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>To recap those changes: The Brew Crossword is heading to Saturdays and the headline quiz is moving to Thursdays.</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Now to the quiz. </strong>Three of the following election-related headlines are true, and one is made up. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Bitcoin bull Cynthia Lummis </span><span><a href="https://cryptonews.com/news/bitcoin-bull-cynthia-lummis-wins-us-senate-seat-8197.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wins U.S. Senate seat</a></span><span>” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Raccoon </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/X1fikdyut2uv6/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">makes off</a></span><span> with absentee ballot but gets tracked down by ‘hero’ 86-year old Nebraskan farmer”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Kanye West announces '</span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/music/2020/nov/04/kanye-west-announces-kanye-2024-as-he-fails-to-make-election-impact?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kanye 2024</a></span><span>' as he fails to make election impact”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Vote counting </span><span><a href="https://www.joe.co.uk/news/vote-counting-machine-ink-255018?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stops</a></span><span> in key U.S. state as machine runs out of ink"</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eElection update: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJoe Biden was projected to win \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2020-election/trump-biden-wait-vote-counting-continues-states-michigan-pennsylvania-n1246402?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMichigan and Wisconsin\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, two crucial states President Trump had carried in 2016. With ballots still being counted, several states remain too close to call, so we don’t know the results of the election just yet.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore election: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1324108200141082624?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at odds with the democratic process, President Trump said his campaign “claimed, for Electoral Vote purposes” a few of the most contested battleground states, including North Carolina and Michigan. Twitter labeled the tweet as misleading, as it has done with several Trump tweets in recent days. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMARKETS\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/04/markets-powered-big-tech-shake-off-uncertain-election-results?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHonk If You Like Legislative Gridlock\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"gridlock in D.C.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDMxL2dyaWRsb2NrX2luX2RfYy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile Joe Biden has a much easier path than President Trump to 270 electoral votes, Republicans are expected to retain control of the Senate, setting up potential \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/04/biden-future-if-wins-434013?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elegislative gridlock\u003c/a\u003e between the executive branch and Congress that makes LA rush hour seem tame. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn fact, the specific combo of a Democratic president, Democratic House of Representatives, and Republican Senate hasn’t happened since 1900. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eStocks still went wild\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany investors had speculated a “blue wave” of Democratic candidates would sweep across America on election night. Such an outcome would have significantly boosted the chances of a coronavirus stimulus deal passing, but the prospect of more regulation and antitrust investigations under Democratic lawmakers gave Big Tech the heebie-jeebies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The “blue wave” ended up being more of a ripple, and Big Tech \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/04/big-tech-stocks-soar-as-results-still-come-in-from-nail-biter-election.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent gangbusters\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday, powering the tech-heavy Nasdaq up nearly 4%. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAccording to Josh Brown of Ritholtz Wealth Management, U.S. stocks had their best post-election day rally ever.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe biz implications\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA gridlocked Congress wouldn’t just help Zuck, Bezos, and Co. escape greater regulatory scrutiny. Healthcare stocks also \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-04/health-stocks-wake-up-to-best-of-all-worlds-after-election-day?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped\u003c/a\u003e on the reduced likelihood of any significant drug pricing reforms passing. Uber (+15%) and Lyft (+11%) rounded out the market’s jolly mood with a policy win of their own: Prop 22 passed in California, protecting their gig-economy business model from an existential crisis.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut buyer beware.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe last time Congress looked similar to the one we \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ecould\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e end up with (in a Biden win scenario) was from 2001–2003, when Republican president George Bush was dealt a Republican House, a Democratic Senate, and a national emergency. Over those two years, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-bad-historical-parallel-for-tech-investors-11604507035?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe Dow tanked 20%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and the Nasdaq lost half its value.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Without the support of the Senate, a Biden presidency could face an uphill battle to enact major policy changes or pass a sweeping stimulus deal. The knee-jerk reaction from investors? \"Fine by us.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Paris\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the U.S. \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/11/03/930312701/u-s-officially-leaving-paris-climate-agreement?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eofficially withdrew\u003c/a\u003e from the Paris Climate Agreement, the 2015 international accord struck by nearly 200 countries committing to sharply reducing emissions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow we got here: \u003c/strong\u003eLeaving the agreement was a key plank in President Trump’s 2016 campaign. He notified the United Nations of his intention to bail exactly a year and one day ago. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e In the biz world, the Paris Agreement has been an influential North Star for pollution reduction targets. Fossil fuel companies such as BP have shuffled their operations to help meet its goals. Major banks such as JPMorgan and Barclays, after outcry from activists, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-pledges-to-push-clients-to-align-with-paris-climate-agreement-11602018245?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave used\u003c/a\u003e their power as investors to persuade clients to minimize their carbon footprints. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eJoe Biden has pledged to rejoin the Paris Agreement if he’s elected. Under a Biden administration, the U.S. could be back on the list in mid-February. But if President Trump holds on to the presidency, we’re likely out for good. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" href=\"https://apnews.com/article/international-news-dubai-migrant-workers-saudi-arabia-united-arab-emirates-6cb5e681b00893e200fec707d92dba06?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" workers.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe kingdom’s oil-dependent economy has attracted workers from all over the world hoping to piggyback on the energy boom. It’s been such a popular work destination that foreigners now account for about a third of Saudi Arabia’s total population.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHowever, under the Saudi “kafala” labor system, these workers are subject to severe restrictions, such as not being able to leave the country or switch jobs without their employers’ permission. Human rights groups say the system is easily exploited to abuse workers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eSaudi Arabia isn’t lifting kafala measures because it feels particularly regretful. The move is part of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/12/business/saudi-arabia-oil-mbs/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eVision 2030\u003c/a\u003e that seeks to reduce the country’s dependence on oil and give it a broader makeover to attract international investments. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s also not the first Gulf state to ditch the kafala system. Qatar, which is hosting the 2022 World Cup, announced similar labor reforms in August.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\"
